p: Chewable gel tablets basis was prepared using gelatin (Carl Roth GmbH + Co. KG, Karlsruhe, Germany), distilled water (LUHS laboratory, Kaunas, Lithuania), and glycerol (99+% vegetable origin; Chem-Lab, Zedelgem, Belgium). Thyme herb (A. Karvelis therapy-phytotherapy company, Švenčionys, Lithuania) and sugar (Pfeifer and Langen Marketing Sp., Poznan, Poland) were used for flavor, color, and odor. Sodium benzoate (Berchem, city, Lithuania), 96% ethanol (Vilniaus degtinė, Vilnius, Lithuania), citric acid (Carl Roth GmbH + Co. KG, Karlsruhe, Germany), and Myristica fragrans seed (from Grenada; supplier Spaisvilė, Pašaltuonys, Lithuania) extracts, hydrolat and essential oil were used as preservatives. Chewable gel tablets were prepared using silicone gummy bear form. Different concentrations of ethanol were used as an additive material for extracts.
